titleStmt.title: A catalogue of excellent books, in Greek, Latin and English; consisting of divinity, history, phylosophy, geopraghy, poetry, and miscellanies, in all volumes. Which will be sold by auction at Toms Coffee House adjoying to Ludgate, on Monday the 15th of October, 1694; beginning at 3 in the afternoon, and, so continue daily till all be sold. Conditions of sale. 1 He that bids most is the B[uyer], if any difference arise, which the company cannot decide, the book to be exposed again to sale. 2 The books for ought we know are perfect, if any appear otherwise before they are taken away, the buyer may take or leave them. 3 That every person be obliged to give in his name and place of abode, paying also 5s. in the pound for what he buyes if demanded; and be obliged to take his books away within [damaged] ...ays after the sale is ended. Catalogues are distributed gratis at Mr. Partridges at Charing-Cross, Mr. Metcalfes in Drury-Lane, Mr. Hargraves in Holbourn, Mr. Joys under the Royal Exchange, booksellers. And at the place of sale.

notesStmt.note: Page 1 of second sequence with caption title: Libri theolog. histor. & miscell. in Gr. Lat. folio.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
